result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry N Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two  and all other sentences.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and all other sentences.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry N Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (36 pages) commencing JULY 23, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Melvina Harris Thompson.

  AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 2 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2 and all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

  AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 2 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1 and all other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, as a condition of extended supervision under case 2014CF862, or if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT.

48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. 

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.    mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #3 and COUNT #4 dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNTS #1 and #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-23-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Henry N. Evans in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 For the reasons as stated on the record, the Court heard and granted State's Motion to Admit the 911 Transcript.  Defense objected to the admission of the 911 call.   Parties remain in trial posture.  Case passed to afternoon.   mld
State's Motion to Admit 911 Call, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Upon the request of parties, case adjourned for further Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-10-2014 at 8:30 pm.  Parties are working on a possible resolution.   mld

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  All available discovery was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for trial:  Cases 2013CF5170, 2014CF862 and 2014CF1458.  Defense objects to the consolidation of cases.  The Court would consider any brief or motion filed by defense regarding the consolidation of cases.  Court ordered case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-12-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-14-2014 at 8:30 am.    mld

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jasmine W. and Kiara E. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Henry N Evans in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Henry N Evans in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant pleads Not Guilty to COUNT 1 and 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
